task.title: Assembling the Bendix Drive to the Starting Motor
task.shortdesc: Properly assemble the Bendix Drive to prevent damage to the starter motor.

prereq.note: The bearing must be properly aligned and not fitted too tightly to prevent damage.

step.cmd: Fit the stop nut or bearing into the mounting bracket on the starting motor.
step.info: Ensure the fit allows the bearing to turn easily with your fingers.

step.cmd: If the bearing fit is too tight, carefully dress it down using an oil stone.

taskbody.result: The Bendix Drive will be properly assembled to the starting motor with correct bearing alignment and tension.

postreq.note: An overly tight bearing fit can cause the bearing to freeze to the bracket and seriously damage the starter.
